author: En Sabah Nur
text: And majority of the times, we don't even know why we're rioting. Before I was born, there was legit reasons. But now... there is none. Especially seeing that we're not gonna collectively plan shit AFTER rioting. https://t.co/zR2yoYDxRg

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
Too many people keep showing they don't value my energy and effort as of late and I'm getting sick of it. 

Partially, that's on me. I keep trying and being merciful but now, I have to put my foot down. 

It's time I be the main antagonist. Get my priorities in order....

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
Master your spending power. Be accountable of the budgets you drew out. Know your target audience, stop going so hard to get non-Blacks to support your product. 

Above all else, set better examples. If you have children or planning on having such, show them how to be winners.

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
Brothers and Sisters, if you have a business or brand for atleast 2-3 years and you're still employed then you're doing something wrong. 

I thought the whole point to having a business/brand was so you don't have to work for anyone anymore.

author: En Sabah Nur
text: Realistically speaking, the focus on family shouldn't negatively impact on the quality of life. And vice versa.

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
This weekend has made come to a serious conclusion.... 

My priorities are all fucked up. I've put my family over my quality of life. 

Don't get it twisted... I've grown, matured and achieved a few successes in life. But I'm not satisfied. THAT is on me because of some decisions

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
Debatable. There are some sisters who admit to being or have been mistreated and they still find it in their hearts to love Black Men. 

Funny enough, I knew of some thats been surrounded by good Black Men and yet, they still view us as less then because of friends/relatives.... https://t.co/E5vRZzqq3T

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
On a funny note, I actually wouldn't mind being on a reality show as long as it's full of Black people and it's competition-based.

I'd do some challenges for a couple of hundred thousand. And if it was love-based, she'd have to be the most wholesome Black female celeb... lol

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
If we truly want freedom and to advance as a people then we need to show up. Plain and simple. Not just for our blood and or when it's convenient for us. 

Given how I carry myself, I would want a Black Man or Black Woman to look out for mines when I'm not present.

author: En Sabah Nur
text: "It couldn't have been me," they would say. And yet, it was them. Granted, they may not have been in the actual situation but they witnessed it. They let their brother get accosted by a devil. They allowed their sister to be verbally abused. They allowed a Black child to get hurt

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
In order for the collective to fall through with accountability on a large scale, we must check the individuals. 

Many talk a good game but when the heat is on, I've seen plenty of people fold. Hell, the ones that are loud have proven to not be about it.

author: En Sabah Nur
text: Slew of reasons for that. Most of them involve the devils but the rest was on us. Malcolm X, Dr. John Henrik Clarke, Dr. Ben and a few master teachers made it their business to tell us what was going on. Problem was it wasn't popular smh https://t.co/s2jTd0ZbDN

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
You cannot expect or want something good when you're not even good. 

Septums and pronouns hate men but want a good man. Some males are pro-hoes but want a dignified woman. 

You cannot serve two masters.

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
Picture yourself as a Black youth; you're fascinated with the sciences(chemistry, geology, physics), building and architecture or engineering, robotics and computer tech... and you have a parent or guardian that think like the quoted tweet.

Still motivated about those fields? 😒 https://t.co/9dMG5VQwkp

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
I have a slew of nieces and nephews, most of them are under 10yrs old. Thankfully, enough of my siblings are in NYC.

Every chance I get, I make it my business to teach them something. From sitting down with them reading to counting, a lil' history to self defense.

author: En Sabah Nur
text:
Or wherever as long as it's on a road to failure. 

To paraphrase Malcolm X, we have too many fools that's letting the enemies teach our children. Niggras make excuses all the time as to why Black youth can't go to Afrikan-centered schools or be homeschooled.
